result.execSummary:
The defendant Olivia Marianne Bath was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bond on file shall be applied to amounts due. Amounts due on case 22FO80 of $263.50 and 22TR478 of $924.50 are also payable as a condition of probation. 
lf probation will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. lf the defendant's probation is revoked with outstanding financial obligations and a jail sentence is ordered at the sentencing after revocation, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis. Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or school or a combination thereof.
Defendant shall take medications only as prescribed.  
Def shall pay Dept. of Corrections supervision fees.
Defendant shall not enter any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. Huber release on condition time for work or school.
